@DrKittensaurus @margaritaloxas See also:

The moral results (in aggregate) of the 2010 passage of the #ACA, by generating massive political opposition and delaying the possibility of ‚Äòsingle-payer‚Äô or other universal insurance schemes for potentially _decades_, could go either way in the eye of history.

subs.text:
@DrKittensaurus @margaritaloxas Perhaps those resulting inequalities will be what it takes to rethink and reform health care funding?

If most people don‚Äôt realize the scale of the problem until _their own_ family falls into medical debt, then most people won‚Äôt prioritize working/voting to fix the root causes.

@SolitudinarianA @Misty_Melanie It‚Äôs hard not to ‚Äòmiss intent‚Äô when that intent conflicts with logic (e.g. consistency with past statements), and the plain meaning of language.

Communication is a two-way street, and any failed communication (even if one party is ‚Äòneuro-atypical‚Äô) indicates both sides can grow.

subs.text:
@Dennis_Ramen @FemiYahtzee It is:

1. hard (logistically speaking, to do at scale - i.e. each district needs to decide to take action, then decide what action to take, then hire/manage contractors)

2. unlike post-9/11 security, not backed by lobbyists and high-margin consultants

See also: infrastructure

@MIL_STD @andexihaeienni Nothing saying one with limited military vehicles couldn‚Äôt use both: commercial trucks for some areas and military ones for others.

Also a combination, in a ‚Äòrelay‚Äô fashion (i.e. commercial for medium/long distance, then transfer to military for ‚Äòlast-mile‚Äô off-road delivery).

subs.text:
@ReflectiveKen @AuthorConfusion @jonsteingard I thought the (fictional) description was more akin to a blender or a parallel-to-serial encoder;

i.e. the matter isn‚Äôt converted to energy, but rather sent in a very tight stream (as subatomic or perhaps quantum particles?) and then reassembled (much as a 3d printer does).

@Lift_Our_Voice Exactly.
  Make new friends.
    Ask if they are registered to vote; if not, offer to help them to find out how to register or request mail/#absentee ballots.

Offer to walk with them to the polls, or help to arrange rides for those who need it.

  Election day should be a party!
